sources.title: The Pirates of Penzance
sources.description: The McGill Savoy Society presents THE PIRATES OF PENZANCE, or, The Slave of Duty Composed by Arthur Sullivan Libretto by W. S. Gilbert CREATIVE TEAM AND CREW Stage Director … Coralie Heiler Musical Director … Ian Plansker Producer … Daniel Benjamin Miller Stage Managers … Gabi Kofsky, Cathleen Ma Chorus Master … Didier Blach-Laflèche Lighting Designer … Asa Kohn Set Designer … Jean-Claude Olivier Costume and Prop Designer … Nicole Heiler Run Crew … Fred Azeredo, Evelyn Burvant, Krystie Nguyen Hair and Makeup … Megan Yang For Vanier College … David Scott ORCHESTRA, conducted by Ian Plansker Flute … Vincent Canciello, Chloe Martin Piccolo … Chloe Martin Oboe … Sophie Cohen Clarinet … Carl Ek, Gabriela Janssen Bassoon … Ellis Montes Trumpet … Thomas Neocleous Horn … Jonah Stemen Trombone … Brandon Berube, Malena Lorenson Percussion … Carmen Mancuso Violin I … Fiona Marchetto, Jonathan Zitouni Violin II … Thea Clark, Margaux Herry Viola … Julian Huang Cello … Alistair Mariz Bass … Zeltzin Maciel CAST Major-General Stanley … Daniel Benjamin Miller (Pirates) Richard, the Pirate King … Arthur Anderson Samuel, his lieutenant … Philippe Courtemanche Frederic, his apprentice … Didier Blach-Laflèche Ruth, a piratical maid-of-all-work … Natalie Demmon James … Michael Quinsey Chorus Pirates … Matthew Erskine, Laurent W. Lachaussée, Pierce Pesant, Jordan Prentice, Dancing: Fred Azeredo (Major-General Stanley's daughters) Mabel … Angela Marino Edith … Eden Augustine Kate … Megan Danbrook Isabel … Caeleigh McDonald Chorus Daughters … Molly Frost, Hali Kremen-Hallowell, Alice Wu, Kira Yep-Toumayan (Policemen — Pirates in Act I) Edward, Sergeant of Police … Matthew Erskine Chorus Policemen … Laurent W. Lachaussée, Pierce Pesant, Michael Quinsey
